data.chText: （尤指因某人去世引起的）悲伤，悲痛，伤心
data.enText: a feeling of great sadness, especially when sb dies

data.chText: 丈夫去世时她悲痛欲绝。
data.enText: She was overcome with grief when her husband died.
They were able to share their common joys and griefs.
something that causes great sadness

data.chText: 没有孩子是他们的一块心病。
data.enText: It was a grief to them that they had no children.
problems and worry
He caused his parents a lot of grief.
come to grief

data.chText: 以彻底失败而告终；惨遭失败
data.enText: to end in total failure
to be harmed in an accident

data.chText: 好几个人都在结了冰的人行道上摔伤了。
data.enText: Several pedestrians came to grief on the icy pavement.
give sb grief (about/over sth)

data.chText: 对某人很生气（或烦恼）；指责某人
data.enText: to be annoyed with sb and criticize their behaviour
good grief!
used to express surprise or shock
Good grief! What a mess!

means: (尤指因某人去世引起的)悲痛

data.enText: come to grief

data.chText: 以彻底失败而告终；惨遭失败
data.enText: to end in total failure
to be harmed in an accident

data.chText: 好几个人都在结了冰的人行道上摔伤了。
data.enText: Several pedestrians came to grief on the icy pavement.
give sb grief (about/over sth)

data.chText: 对某人很生气（或烦恼）；指责某人
data.enText: to be annoyed with sb and criticize their behaviour
good grief!
used to express surprise or shock
Good grief! What a mess!

example: her death was a great grief to John

tr: intense sorrow caused by loss of a loved one (especially by death)

value.def: Grief is a feeling of extreme sadness.

example.ex: ...a huge outpouring of national grief for the victims of the shootings...
example.tran: 举国上下对枪击事件中的遇害者所表现出的万分悲痛之情

example.ex: Their grief soon gave way to anger.
example.tran: 他们的悲痛迅速转化为愤怒。

value.def: If something comes to grief, it fails. If someone comes to grief, they fail in something they are doing, and may be hurt.

example.ex: So many marriages have come to grief over lack of money...
example.tran: 许多婚姻都因缺钱而以失败告终。

example.ex: He was driving a Mercedes racer at 100 mph and almost came to grief.
example.tran: 他当时驾驶着一辆梅塞德斯赛车以每小时100英里时速度飞驰，险些出事。

value.def: Some people say 'Good grief' when they are surprised or shocked.

example.ex: 'He's been arrested for theft and burglary.' — 'Good grief!'
example.tran: “他因为偷窃和入室盗窃而被逮捕了。”——“我的天哪！”

trans: 遭到灾难，出事；以失败告终
天哪；天啊；无尽悲伤；有益的悲伤；很伤心

partsOfSpeech.dec: ag 加强 + grav 重 + ate 使… → 加重
ag 表加强 + griev 重 + e → 加重悲伤的心情 → 使悲痛
grav 重 + id …的 → 重的 → 怀孕的
gravid 怀孕的 + a → 孕妇
grav 重 + it 走 + ate 做，造成，使… → 重力使之往下走 → 受重力作用下沉
grav 重 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 庄重；地心吸力
griev 重 + ance 表状况 →〔工作〕很繁重 → 抱怨
griev 重 + e → 心情极度沉重 → 使悲伤
griev 重 + ous …的 → 悲伤的；严重的
